intro: Hackelia minima, commonly known as dwarf fairybells, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its small stature and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine landscapes. Hackelia minima is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
